review: Slow, but super friendly. I feel bad for bringing in a million debit cards for a pick up order, but the hostess' are always forgiving when they have to split the check. A little slow, but that's expected in this slow-moving town. Oh, and they now have the RR Card, but I've since lost mine :(

Worst service ever. Our waitress literally only took our order and brought us our check. The hostess took our drink order, brought the drinks, brought the food, and refilled the drinks that sat empty for an extended period of time. Our "waitress" stopped by once to check on us in between. She was socially retarded and made rude comments to my husband like "Are you okay? You don't look so good"...uh...he's been driving for 7 hours, thanks for the insult. And taking forever.  Ceasar wrap had no ceasar dressing on it. Fries were overcooked. Salad was disappointing also...foccocia was floury, hard, and not as well seasoned as I've had it at other Red Robins. Cheese on the salad was dried out. Tomatoes in the salad were mushy and warm. Chicken on salad was super greasy (Think KFC).  Waited forever for the check. Would have paid cash had we not wanted credit on our Red Robin Royalty Card. However, when she ran the card, we noticed she had not done our Royalty Card, so we didn't even get credit for the two entrees we bought. The receipt always says how many entrees you have toward your free one; our receipt had no mention. Now that really chapped my ass. And not in a good way, either. This is hands down the worst Red Robin we've ever been to. We will not be returning.

I  normally like red robin this one was a bit of a let down  compared to the others I have ate at . the shake was not as shakey like usually or thick  I was also stared at most of the time I was there

We have gone monthly and the service and food quality keeps getting worse. Last visit our order wasn't put in and after waiting all that time for our food, my husband didn't get the burger he ordered! Your forewarned. We will go elsewhere for a burger.
Best chain restaurant burger in town (options are medium or well-done).  Service is excellent (5 stars for service).

First of all, the burgers are pretty diverse and tasty washed down with a ginormous mug of beer they offer. Staff is always friendly and the seating is plentiful. The only thing I didn't care for is that it kind of feels like you are in a Frat house as kids act stupid at the bar. Other than that, it's great to at least check out.

Perhaps I'm reviewing this chain through fond-memory glasses. When I was in college, Red Robin was one of our go-to places ... and they haven't found their way to Orlando (yet). But when visiting the fam in Southern Oregon, I tend to steer us this way. There are a ton of unusual burger options, as well as some great salads and wraps. For me, put avocado or guac on it and I'm probably going to order it. And maybe a refill or two of their bottomless steak fries. And lest I forget why it was a college go-to place, they have some fun, alcoholic milkshakes. (And, oh yeah, regular ones, too.) So yes, pretty average location for this chain, but wrapped in lots of nostalgia for me, so I still opt there, even when I'm trying to stick to non-chain, local fare. If that doesn't say "fan," I don't know what does.

Ok. Let's begin by saying: I'm not a fan of chains. When I was younger, I LOVED going to Red Robin for the milkshakes and the endless fries. But this was before I understood the ramifications of where you put your money. I'm not going to launch into some political rant here, don't worry. But I will say that I am much happier giving my money and my business to a locally-owned, family restaurant than I am a major chain with 5,000 restaurants nationwide. Chances are, they don't need the cash from me. Furthermore, what scares me a little bit about chains is that they have this menu that every single restaurant adheres to. There are no gourmet chefs in the kitchen, or even a mom-and-pop style cook who has labored over his or her recipes for years to perfect them. This rings true for me every time I have been to Red Robin as an adult: the food is average to poor, the service is mediocre, and the atmosphere is cookie-cutter.  But I think the thing that bothers me the most about this place is that they use non-recyclable, plastic dixie cups for EVERY SINGLE dip, dressing, and condiment. Want more ranch dressing for your fries? Generate 4 more dixie cups of waste. If this is true for every Red Robin in the US, think about how much waste is being generated every day, just by those red plastic dixie cups.  Well, now that I've sounded like a hippy though this whole post, I'm gonna go hug some trees or something.

Hey there Medford Red Robin!!! Let me tell you why I will never return to your location. Let's start it off with a 2-minute wait at the front door, a manager suggesting a 6 top sit at the bar when he finally came out. Hmm.. Okay. We sat down in the lower section by the drink station. Our server didn't come to the table for 10 minutes because "she wasn't told she got a table sat". Um. Shouldn't you keep an eye on your section to begin with? Our drinks took over 5 mins, because for some reason she had to go to another drink station besides the one we were literally right next to? Two in our party ordered the new "Oktoberfest Burger" which according to our email said royalty members could get a sneak preview of and clearly the staff had no idea about this, except one server who said you did have all that was needed to make the burger. My grandmother ordered a diet pepsi, and it was flat and mixed with rootbeer. The manager "Billy" said there was nothing he could do to fix it. Word for word. When it could have been as simple as, "I'm sorry, our diet isn't working tonight, I would love to get you something else" as opposed to making unnecessary excuses as to how he had no control. Twenty-five minutes later our food arrived. My entree as well as all three burgers we ordered was cold. The "Oktoberfest"s were missing some of the ingredients. The chicken sandwich we ordered was barely warm. When Billy returned, he said, "There's no way I can make you happy." And my fiancé stated that by saying that he was already giving up, and he was cutting off communication. To which this manager said he was disrespecting him and he needed to leave. Absolutely in no way was he being disrespectful, he was trying to help the manager better this really terrible situation.  Our server was "DD", minus her mistake of letting us sit for 10 minutes, she was lovely. This manager though, ruined everything. My grandmother had literally just flown in after a long flight and this was the disservice we received. Billy is ill equipped to problem solve and communicate. Things can go wrong at a restaurant, but show heart and try to mend things and simply be nice and give good service and we could have left happy full customers. Instead, you have lost a customer; we spent our money at Applebee's, who had impeccable service by the way. We were greeted once we got in the door, sat right away, and received our food and drinks with a smile and in a timely manner. And this is a reoccurring event; in the last couple years (mind you we go for the food not the terrible service you consistently provide) I have had a hair on my plate, a big black long one that came with no apology to my oblivious server. Another time we had a server never once ask us how our food was, I had to go to the bar for a refill of water, she also entirely forgot our appetizer, and when the expo brought our entrees out and I mentioned we were supposed to have a starter, she didn't say or do anything. Our server spent more time gossiping and flirting with her coworkers than she did talking to us. When I spoke to the manager (again Billy) I informed him of her poor service, to which he replied (word for word), "I can talk to her, but I can't guarantee that it will do any good." Are you freaking kidding me? Don't you pay people to do their job? And if she's not doing her job, why the heck are you letting her work?  So thank you, for ruining one of my favorite places to eat. You won't see us in there again. 301395 Reference number for corporate. Only reason why you have 1 star is because I have to.

I appreciate any restaurant that cares enough to listen, genuinely.  After sharing my experience with Red Robin leadership, they made it right.  I felt like there was a deep concern for my experience, and because of this, we'll give it another go! Thanks for listening!

Pros: Decent burgers, bottomless milkshakes and steak fries. YUM. Cons: HORRIBLE service. The first time I went here it wasn't that bad, it was ok. The second time it was just awful. We had to wave our server down every time we wanted a refill for our "bottomless" fries or milkshake. He just did everything he could to avoid helping us. Yes it was busy. But not for a moment did we have his full attention.

Originally, based on the BBQ chicken sandwich I ordered and the miserable service we received, I would have rated this visit a 1 star. However, Melissa B. Came to our table and asked how our meal was and listened very intently as i explained how unhappy I was with my meal. She took our words in and apologized immensely for their shortcoming with their attempt to cook us a delicious meal. Our conversation with Melissa totally changed our perspective on the restaurant. We went from never wanting to go back to WHOA, we should come more often and ask for her as our server. Wonderful lady and definitely recommend you ask if she is working and request her station.

Really love the chicken burgers, sometimes the sweet potato fries can be a little soggy, they tried to blame it on the product several times but they have had these long enough to know how to cook them. Usually service in the bar is quicker.

A couple of days ago is the first time I tried Red Robin. I've seen the commercials and heard nothing but good things from my friend that used to live in Medford, so my boyfriend and I decided to try it out (he has been to Red Robin several times in New York).  We came on a busy night and had to wait for 15 minutes, which honestly wasn't too bad since the other place we wanted to go to had a 30 minute wait. We were seated and ordered our drinks (the strawberry vojito is pretty good btw) and didn't have to wait too long at all. I ordered some mac n cheese riblet thing while my boyfriend ordered this meal that was an assortment of seafood. I don't know if it was because I was starving, but I LOVED every bit of my meal (aside from the coleslaw...it is like parsley, nobody eats it). My boyfriend enjoyed it...wasn't blown away but enjoyed it. The waitress was nice...seemed really stressed out and tired but hey, I know how that is. I would definitely go here again :)

Great burgers. I've been here a couple times and most recently just went in while I wasn't feeling well and ordered the clam chowder which was delicious as well. My friend I went with ordered the baja bacon sandwich which I tasted and was also delicious. I would have gave 5 stars but there was some mix-up with our drinks and they arrived slowly (and after the food).

Expensive for what you get.  Small serving too ... the salad and soup combination I got was small, so I mooched two of the sweet potato fries my wife ordered.  They were salty.  Sweet potato fries ought not to be salty.  Okay, so I'll mooch some of the steak fries from my son's plate.  Mushy and substandard.  The two stars come from middle and oldest sons' assessment of their hamburgers.  They looked good too.  Probably should have ordered one too, but I was trying to keep a reasonable budget.

It is pretty interesting to me that after a night of leaving two other Medford establishments for incredibly poor service (Howiee's) and filthy tables (new Sushi restaurant downtown by Porter's-they literally "cleaned" our table by flipping over the dirty/stained tablecloth and laying it back down. Uh...the stains had gone through...we left immediately) the night was rescued by a waitress in the bar at Red Robin. Red Robin! I mean, I like Red Robin as much as the next person: decent burgers, big fries, great shakes, but our server (I can't recall her name!!) was outstanding.  We sat down and she greeted us immediately. The bar was busy, it was a Saturday evening. She asked how our evening was and we told her we were at our third restaurant of the night to try and have dinner. She went above and beyond to make our experience great...brought us drinks and fries right away, didn't hover, but paid attention. She was friendly, prompt, professional. Our food was good and you know...it's Red Robin...average price, decent food, but our server made the difference on this night.  One tip: sit in the bar if possible (less screaming kids to deal with) and ask for your burger well done!

Once again, a ZERO for "service" and a 4 for food. I ordered French Onion soup and a salad with my burger.  One would expect the soup and salad may come out before, no? Nope.  Two plates all at the same time, so the table had no room. For the THIRD time (do I never learn??), the bottomless fries weren't.  I asked twice to get fries refilled.  And drinks, and water. Too bad. The food is consistently good, but so overpowered by the consistently poor service.  The greeters are nice and helpful, holding the door opened, promptly seating us etc., but good grief, is it that hard to serve salads before the burger, and to maybe ask if I'd like more fries, water, drink, etc.??? I guess it is. Third time, why go back?  Other places have good food too, but few have service this bad. My dining partner had the Irish Beer shake.  WOW!  Delicious!   Too bad.  I doubt I'd go back to this one.  Other Red Robins do much better.

This place can NEVER seem to get our order right. One of us is almost always waiting for them to redo the order while the rest of the party has finished the meal. Depending on the manager, sometimes the meal will be comped (Scott always comps it which I very much appreciate!!), but often it's not.  The bottomless fries are usually brown, luke warm, and simply nasty as if they've been sitting under the warmer far too long.  We've always loved Red Robin, until we moved here.  If you are from another town and get excited to see Red Robin, keep going because this will not meet your expectations.  I give it 2 stars instead of 1 because the service is usually good and when they do get it right, it's good.  Too bad they can't get it right more often.

I used to go to bend Oregon's restaurant a lot and last year we moved to Medford. Oh my god what a a huge difference. I have Given this place 4 chances and every time they just suck! Medium cooked burgers are not bright pink all the way through and cold. and everyone hates getting their apps and burgers at the same time usually within 10 mins after sitting down hence the undercooked food. I just won't go their again.

After a slump in service and quality of the food, they have improved. We have started visiting more often. Only 1 time in the last 5 or 6 visits did we leave pissed (the waitress forgot my drink 4 times and we received the wrong food - really lousy visit). The other times we left very happy. We know when we see our favorite waiter in the bar area that we will be taken care of.

I very rarely go to chain restaurants. Mostly because they are boring and I'd rather support a local business. On a recent trip through Medford with my mom and sister, we had dinner at this Red Robin. I was driving and decided to stop here because my mom kept saying "fries" and I recalled Red Robin having good fries. I was surprised to find out that they carry the Boca vegan burger now! Hooray! Instead of fries, they allow you to substitute steamed broccoli (or any of a number of alternatives) for little to no additional charge. My vegan veggie burger was tasty with a spicy mustard and the broccoli made me feel less guilty. My mom and sister split a BLT on a croissant which they raved about.  My only complaint is that I ran out of water very quickly and it was never refilled. I understand that it was 9pm on a Thursday night and they were shutting down, but I specifically mentioned I'd need a lot of water. Small potatoes though. In all, it was a mostly pleasant experience and the price was right.

Finished the 216-mile Cascade Lakes Relay the previous day and needed to load back up on protein to replace what I lost. Started with a monster-sized salted caramel shake. Comes with the metal tin for refills, so you get two shakes for the price of one. 'Merica!    The caramel flavor was fairly mild initially, but as I worked my way through the shake it got progressively saltier and caramelier as I went. Moved on to the Blue Cheese Burger. Good slab of beef, cooked just like I wanted. Blue cheese had just enough bite. Bun was tender and soft and flavorful. Toppings were juicy. Like all the burgers, it comes with unlimited steak fries. When you need to replace calories lost, or when you need to gain 10lbs in a hurry because you are too damn skinny, there is nothing quite as appealing as unlimited fried food. I went nom nom nom nom nom to my heart's content. Red Robin, if I was in you every day I would weigh 400lbs and my salivary glands would run dry. But for a "catch up after burning 8,000 calories in two days" meal, you guys are the best!

While on my way to airport looking for a good place to eat that wasn't mcdonalds or wendys or burger king..I discovered red robin. I've been to other locations and read the reviews for this location and I think it just gets a bad rap. My server keenan was very attentive and refilled fries and drinks as requested. Despite it being dinner hour and lots of families with little kiddies about the staff performed admirably. Attentive and friendly staff and low prices can't be beat...good job red. Robin....

What free fry and drink refills? We were never even asked how our food was much less fry and drink refill!! Weak weak weak!! This place is sucky! This Red Robin Location in HORRIBLE. First it looks like the 90's threw up all over it!! Is one big hot mess... both tables I had them move me, rocked every time anyone leaned onto it... in a normal way!! Brought us wrong food!! Tried to tell me it was ok to keep it even though it was for my daughter which I never get the kids meal for because it is weak!! So they tried to give her someone elses suck e kids burger then tell me she can just have it... no no no!! My 5 year old knows whats goos she wants a burger with lettuce and tomato that you can actually see the burger!! The Kids Mac n' cheese is false advertisement it looks like good creamy mac but you get it it is microwaved old made crap mac and cheese from the box... throw up in my mouth!!  DONT GO HERE!!

The food was mediocre at best. The service was the worst I've ever experienced. There were more staff members than people dining, which would be great if you could get someone to refill your drink. All of the employees treated their job like it was chitchat after high school time, including standing in groups around an empty table chatting and 6 employees huddled around the hostess stand giggling. As I said, none of that would have been a problem if either the service or the food were decent.

Great service, not so great food.  Chicken breast on salad was cold and looked strange-as if the grill marks were fake.  Hubbies wrap was small and no where near as full as the picture on the menu.  Pretty expensive for what it is.

We almost always have a meal here when I am visiting in Medford. Everyone in the family loves it, even the hard to please little ones. This visit was no exception. Apparently, most of town had the same idea, a great place to go for dinner the day after Christmas. It is a large space, exceptionally well staffed, and though the foyer and arcade room were packed with parties of 2 to 16 (we were 6 and I think the 16 waited outside to be called) we were seated in 20 minutes. And the kids played games while the adults talked, so the time went fast. And yes, it is very loud there, and yes, they really do sing for people's birthdays so fair warning, if that will bother you. The food was good, burgers fresh, all cooked to order as desired and the fries were fresh and hot, yet cooked properly, not rushed out, undercooked. The wait for food was shorter than we expected given the crowd. Our waiter was very attentive and kept great eye contact (being funny) with the kids as he was moving around the tables to keep them entertained while waiting. Really nice guy. Wish we had one like this close to home, but alas, our local place closed some years ago. The style did not play well in my hometown but it sure does in Medford.

I've gotta say this was one of my favorite places to eat, but standards have seemed to have slipped over the last year or so. The service to the table is spotty, you sometimes get a good server, sometimes not.  I'm not sure if it's because we tend to go before or after the crowds but the fry refills always seem cold and stale, when they eventually get back to your table. My two favorite burgers to get there (the pub and the shroom) have since become somewhat tasteless. I have also found that when you say "well done" the burger typically comes a bit more chard and dry, then juicy and cooked through. The burgers themselves have little flavor and in the case of the shroom burger, the toppings aren't flavored either. Its like the mushrooms were just left to soak in warm grease and cheese was melted on top.  Despite it being a previous family favorite, it will probably be a while before we take a chance on this place again.

Friday nights, perfect place to be. Great atmosphere, especially after football and basketball games. The endless fries are never disappointing and the burgers are always great. Try the mushroom Swiss burger, prime. Overall, fun, exciting place to be. Oh yeah, the waiters there are always friendly and smiling! :)

This place is in need of a good cleaning and a complete remodel.  The dining area is just plain icky, one can only imagine how gross the kitchen must be.  We will drive to Roseburg from Grants Pass to get out RR fix from now on.  Gross!  It's 2014 Medford RR...update yourself.....
This place was great when it was new.  Service is slow and the food is cold.  It needs to be updated, it doesn't seen very clean. Way better choices in the valley.

I have eaten here probably a dozen times in the last year.  Only once did my company have sub-par service, most likely because it appeared that they were understaffed at the time.  I commented regarding it and the manager made it right with coupons to try again.  Viola!  Four times since and nothing short of excellent food and service!  I am most of all pleased by the quick attention management gave to my opinion on that one occasion.   Kudos to Red Robin-Medford and the manager I spoke who was very polite and interested in resolving the problem for the future.  (I think his name was Dan if I recall correctly.

I have eaten burgers at this Red Robin from time to time over the years and found them to be okay but not outstanding. I'm not a big fan of their fries but they do have free refills. The service has been good but the place gets quite noisy. However, recently someone recommeded I try their fish & chips. I did and to my surprise they were outstanding. They serve a large portion of 4 flaky white pieces of fish with a light crispy coating. I've been back 3 or 4 times since and had the same great fish & chips every time. They are easily the best in the Medford area. Who would have thought that a place that specializes in burgers would turn out to be such a great place for fish & chips.

I have to update my review and remove one star, the last time I was here (about a week or two ago), it just wasn't as good as I remember!  I used to LOVE their burgers here, when they had the Olympus burger, that was my favorite!  The food was so good, the service was so good!  However today, it wasn't bad, just not exceptional.  So 3 stars suits Red Robin perfectly.  I had the fries, chicken tenders, and riblets, and the fries were great, the chicken was ok, and the riblets were....meh.  I think I should have stuck with my gut and ordered a burger.  Their flavored lemonade was bottomless, however, and that was probably the best part.  My mom got a wrap and she said it was good, but not great.  Once again, 3 stars. And the service...we waited an awful long time for a couple of small orders...and it was around 3pm, so they weren't very busy.  Our server was, as everything has been before, not bad, but not exceptional.  Just A-OK....a definite 3 star place, all around!

Well, maybe the third time's the charm. We got there after the prom crowd had left. The staff looked exhausted. But, they seated us right away, the waitress (Amanda) got to us and looked out for us the rest of the night. She was really awesome! Billie, have to mention this manager by name since he really walked around and watched over everything. Had a problem with the sandwich, but, they took care of it right away. Saw some new faces. So, hopefully, they seem to be bringing in new people who want to be there. And, the manager (a young fellow), came by to check on things. This is such a NICE turn around for this RR! Hope it stays great....DC

The last couple of times I went here both with friends and my husband we had one server who was the rudest person that I have ever met in the food industry. It was so bad that when the manager came by to see how we were liking things I asked him if I could please get another drink of water  He of course did that but he asked me where our server was and I looked at him and said I don't know where she is but we have been waiting for our food for over 45 minutes. When the manager found her it turned out she was giving her undivided attention to a group of her friends that had come in to eat.

wait for the food was long, then the appetizer delivered with the entree, had to ask for silverware.  vessel for fries was a cutsie conical container with no bottom--the metal drew the heat off the fries--just plain weird.
Awesome service, great food. And Awesome Mai Tai's

Red Robin is pretty solid and fairly epic shit. You get a burger and some fries and some ranch and there you go. I mean like sometimes the waiters here don't even like write my orders down so I have to like send my food back but other than that it's some fairly epic shit. Some kid across from me is wearing a coffee filter on his head and he looks like an idiot so that's always nice.
They have the best hamburgers. Everyone needs to try their campfire sauce with their fries!! Their patty melt is also very delicous. Very good resturant.

food was fair... service was fair at best.,,..  Hard to have a conversation with someone when the wait staff is being loud and obnoxious.... She seemed more interested in a friend that walked in than taking care of paying customers.
It's red robins... what can i say? I always get the cluck and fries here. Service was good. It's a chain though so can't really say much more than this.

Pretty tasty stuff. Service was good. Price is decent.  Still confused on the Tavern Burger vs. the Big Tavern Burger, the big tavern has a single 1/4lbs patty and bigger bun and what not. Tavern Burger = 2 patties totalling 1/4 pound, small diameter, but it is like 2 more. Unless you want REALLY spicy stay away from the Ghost Pepper add on. It is basically a metric butt ton of jalapenos and hot sauce. I love spicy food, but this upset my stomach a bit. Everything else was great, service was great. Server was accommodating, we took our time ordering, then as we were about to order a friend saw us and came over to visit for 5+ minutes. Our server was very patient.  Bottomless steak fries were great!

Red with regret; the story of Red Robin will be remembered as 'Lord of the Forgotten Tables'. A chain with mid-level family friendly "card carrying" charm, has broken our burger hearts for the last time.  Digs: If you are one of the few that have never entered the gates of RR imagine jammed walls of photos and paintings capturing the safe pop-art Americana closely tied to an Applebee's decor but not tapping into the local team sports memorabilia; the interior has not varied or changed in the 10+ years I've grazed their menu; Ate: Teriyaki "Bonsai" Burger - when our food finally arrived after a healthy 25min wait, it was a full-flavored, hardy pile of pineapple flavor, sauces, meat trimmings; it's my go-to; no negativity from my menu choice; Bottom-less Fries - steak fries, salted and crisp; it's the staple and survival (flashing back to my college years in Spokane, saving $ for endless RR fries); honestly nothing great but standard craving averted; Service: This is where the stars fell...fast. The staff became allusive almost frightened by feeding the scary rush of business lunch; (cue ghostly howls); we were greeted kindly but then neglected from ordering to the final payment; each step seemed grueling; two of party members had to literally track down the waitress to pay then receive our checks back to finally sign; I kept recalling the hordes of sorority girls flocking to fries in 15+ groups and waiters drowning them in sugary slurps of alcohol and baskets of fun, but this location crashed in an oily fire; Overall: Red Robin can maintain a tolerable menu but their service crumbles with neglect. I love a 2-hour lunch but not when it's due to the overwhelmed waitstaff. From ordering, to plating, to paying it stretched to the point of insult. Most at the table worked for the service industry and understand the madness but it surpassed our patience. Medford has other meaty options that deserve our money and time. This will be my last bottom-less fry basket.

Ok so I used to come here to Red Robin at least 2-3 times a month - the last 6 years or so I've only come a handful of times because it had been so awful. Bad service, food just wasn't as good - BUT TONIGHT Was different! Emily has renewed my faith in Red Robin! The place is packed- had to wait like ten minutes to be seated. I had visions of awful- but then Emily came and introduced herself and let me know she knew we were here. She took our order, got our aps to us and entree and burger came in under 30 minutes. The food was hot this time! The burger was excellent and my chicken was cooked perfect. Emily kept our drinks full, much appreciated. So I will come again now. I will likely ask if Emily is working and ask for her section.
Amazing service. Made us laugh and any meal is better with laughter. The food was great and came quickly despite they were busy.

This place is going down hill...fast. My number 1 issue is the fact that for the SECOND time my server almost forgot to sing my child happy birthday.  This actually happened to us last year and I wasn't about to let it happen again so I reminded them as they were basically pushing us out the door. She said that she forgot and promptly got the group together to sing. These things you should make note of and remember.   I ordered a Whiskey River BBQ burger...it was dry...no BBQ sauce to be found. Really?! It's in the name people!  The service we got here reminded me of children without parents around.  I'm only guessing that because we went on a Wednesday night at 7pm that a main manager had already left and this is why no one was really doing what they were supposed to.  WHY isn't there ketchup on any of the tables anymore?! The whole table had fries and we were never even asked about ketchup.  WHY isn't there any sweeteners on the table? Why when I ordered my ICED TEA wasn't I asked if I needed it?  It's fine that you don't stock these at the table anymore, but when people order things that these items go with,  it needs to be offered. We shouldn't have to ask. EVER! Fries...not really endless anymore. You get ignored and really don't have a chance to ask for any more. When we finally got our servers attention she brought us out 2 baskets and expected our table to share them between us. No no no no!  Never. Going. Back. Again. You guys may still get business no matter what you dish out because you have no competition, but when in and out and 5 guys comes in to town you are going to have to step up your game.

We just stopped in for a quick lunch on our way back to Portland. Our server Keenan was incredible! Fantastic service & attitude.  My daughter left her Nabi tablet in the video game room and the staff was very helpful in trying to find it; we were unsuccessful but I'm hoping that we may get a call in the future. I'd gladly give a reward and pay postage to have it returned!

Food was great. Although they forgot eggs on my salad. And the food took 40+ minutes to get to us while people around us who were seated after us and still got their food before us. Server was great. The tip went straight to him! Overall bad experience

First time eating at a Red Robin. The mushroom burger and fries were delicious. I didn't give it 5 stars cause we had to wait at the front for a while. Other employees saw us and others waiting to be checked in  and no one even bothered to acknowledge us and the restaurant was maybe half full.
If you can get past your drinks getting slammed into your table and being Corrected while asking questions about the menu then go for it.

As a regular here, I usually expect some good (not amazing) food and some half-effort service from a young entitled waitress. HOWEVER, the service tonight from Kali was fantastic. She went above and beyond and never made us feel like a hassle or annoyance. The food came out exactly as ordered and she was attentive to every need throughout the night. Thank you Kali!!

WAY over priced for what you get! I had to season my own burger.....ridiculous! The service was horrible! The only good thing about this place is the bottomless steak fries..... if you can ever get the staffs attention to bring you more. Haven't been in a while & don't plan on going back.
Luv red robin  2day was great our waitress was awesome n on top of everything even being very busy

The bill was at a premium price.  The burger was good.  But the luke warm fries, regardless of the second time I've been here, and 50% of the music is so incredibly terrible.  Order was incorrect but they try hard to fix the errors the first time. This chain needs to up their game with training and supervision.

The Crispy Chicken sandwich is by far my favorite. I typically always get this every time I visit and it is consistently delicious. One out of probably 20 times I have had this sandwich in the past three years has it disappointed me. No tomato, add avocado, and a side of honey mustard for the bottomless steak fries is the way to go. I've always had friendly service as well. This location gets an A+ from me.

I popped in the other afternoon for a burger after golf and red robin hit the spot. I ordered the whiskey river BBQ burger with endless fries of course. Burger good cook right about med rare. The BBQ sauce on this burger is pretty tasty and the onion straws go great with it. Also got the little onion ring tower and that was good too but very filling. I always enjoy rr, and you can't beat the endless steak fries at all! Yum

5 stars based  on the bansai burger. It is a classic, coupled with bottomless fries and the standard RR friendly service, cant be beat. Plus this floor plan is similar to the RR I grew up by. Always good for a kiddos bday too!

Decided to give the Medford Red Robin another chance...wrong decision! Sat at our table for over ten minutes before our waitress came over and said she was unaware our table was hers. Took our order and received the drinks promptly...food took over 20min as people around us who arrived after us had already been served their order. My burger was a dry hockey puck as well as our server was never present. She dropped our check off and we did not see her again. Had to wave down another waiter to take our payment...will never return. Red Robin has gone completely down hill and they feel that customer service is an inconvenience! Sad family date for us:(

The worst burger I've had ever. Dry, the bun fell apart, guacamole on my burger was so hot I had to scrape it off the burger. I gave up after the 3 bites. Our server was terrible. Half the time we had to flag down someone to get anything.  Somehow they feel as though customer service is unnecessary there. This is not our first bad experience with Red Robin. But it will be our last.

Okay, let me start by saying I've never had a bad meal here. The food is always good. But, the service can be slow at times.  I had a chicken sandwich and fries here last week and it was $13.50! with a drink that's like $15.00! That's one heck of a pricey lunch. Anyway, my advise, don't go there if you're in a hurry and bring lots of money.

I love red robin the food and drinks are always so good .Service is fast and pleasant .I am not a big hamburger eater but jimmys in GP and red robin always serve real good hamburgers .I am excited that we may have one more local .

Red robin I don't have much I can think of to say other than the food here is sooooo good the fries are bottomless and you will love them and the desserts are amazing all around great family restaurant
Absolutely love this place.   There food is always good here.   I recommend the teraki chicken.   The staff is very friendly and on top of things.
Always a good place to eat with friends or throw back a Long Island ice tea at the bar. Service is fast and the food is good.

Being someplace that you can go have a burger from a local burger shop, you definitely should. Red robin has some okay food but their service is not all that great, the food is pretty over priced for what you get. You can get a fresh patty for 1/2 the price in town vs their over priced, poor serviced, frozen patties. Their bar is a joke, very minimal drinks that are ridiculously over priced.

My fiance and I ordered take out. They said it would take 15 min. I live 10 min away. So I left the house 10 min later knowing I'd be a tad late since all take out takes longer anyway. I got there and waited another 15 min to get the food in hand. Got home and opened the boxes and each meal had like 10 fries. Considering when you pay the same price to sit in and take out and you get bottomless fries you'd think they wouldn't be skimpy in the take out meals. We pay the same price. Food was decent but not worth the price you pay for take out.

Worst service we have ever had!!  Had an early supper in the bar area.  Two other couples were there also having come in after us .  They received their meals first - all had burgers - and we never did receive our onion rings.  Fries were luke warm and never offered more.  Perhaps if the bar staff spent less time chatting about their cars they could take care of their customers.  Won't ever be eating there again.

Very sad about my experience today. I went to order my usual, that I've been having for years and was sadly disappointed when told the ingredients in it have changed. Seeing that I wouldn't like the new edition, I ordered the California chicken sandwich. It arrived and the chicken was almost raw. Sent it back. Without being asked anything I was brought another one, which at that point I wanted nothing to do with. I changed my order yet again and went with a garden burger (something you can't mess up) and it came incorrectly. Annoyed by the situation I just ate it anyway, seeing as how my party was already done and had been for some time now. I was offered a free sundae for the inconvenience yet still charged.  My issue isn't paying for my meal. My issue is they served me raw chicken and didn't offer to comp my meal. Raw chicken. Hello?!?!

Great bacon cheese burger. Gluten free! Take a little bit of time because they clear and clean a portion of the grill. The cook gloves up and make our food.  Designated Grier for all you can eat fries. Yum!!!

Not my first place of choice for a "good" burger but it is for my kids. This experience our wait was over 25 mins, at the table another 20 mins. The service just wasn't there, My burger was overdone, we weren't offered any refills on lemonade or fries like usual but the campfire sauce with the fries was good. Once  again this place was just OK, fortunately for Red Robin I'm patient.

Horrible experience with this place - not the restaurant but the customers! If that lady behind me b*tched about one more small thing I was going to ask to be sat somewhere else. Server was friendly but a little too friendly that it kept her away from tables. Didn't get a few things and hard to find server or someone who will stop. Fries were pretty crispy, asked for new ones and those were crispy crunchy burnt too. This is not a corporate owned location so have a feeling that's where some of slack came from. Same old Red Robin food in Medford as there is in LA.

Man Red Robin has gone downhill and this location is no exception. Upon arrival there was no host and a staffer sat in the waiting area resting I guess -- she didn't acknowledge my group. Later we were given one drink with no one checking for refills and our onion rings were over fried as if forgotten in the fryer which is probably the case because it took forever.
Excellent service from Ricky! Hot fast food and delicious drinks! Bottomless fries and huge burgers!

I went there today for lunch thinking I would get a great burger. I was highly disappointed with their burgers. I ordered the peppercorn bacon and cheeseburger. The burger was fairly dry as the patty  was overcooked. The peppercorn bacon was so thin you could see thru it; reminded me of the bacon you get at a Denny's. The drinks although you could have refills were $4.99 way overpriced. I would not recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a great burger for a decent price. You would be better off going on down the road to the In-n-out; they make a good burger and they down screw it up with some cheap ass pre-cooked bacon...just saying

We came here today on a Sunday on our way to Washington.  It was packed but we found a good seat at the bar. Service was very good and actually very fast being that busy. Highly recommended. Everyone was very nice. The burnin love is my favorite

Specifically for the hostess! Unfortunately I forgot her name, but she deserves recognition! I placed a late last minute order, and this sweetheart did not give me 1 bit of attitude or fuss over the fact that I was calling in an order 10 minutes prior to their closing. Even when I arrived to pick up my food, she was extremely pleasant and happy to help me. She had brown hair and was working on 9/1/16 taking phone calls and at the front desk. She's awesome!!!!
Very impressed with the environment. Foood was amazing. Margaritas! ! They are revamping the bar menu. Can't wait to try some drinks.

Red Robin is an odd one, for me.  They claim to have Gourmet Burgers, but I typically find their burgers to be unimpressive.  They're not bad...  But when I crave a burger, Red Robin doesn't even pop into my mind.  What I do like are the freckled lemonade (wonderful) and their fries (very good, and bottomless).

My wife and I moved from Portland and love Red Robin. However when we went to the Medford location we were sorely disappointed.  1. The greeters were young ladies who looked like they were barely 12 years old. They were playing with their phones while we stood there for like 3 min or more. When we were finally seated we were close to the door and could hear them talking about personal matters lol.  2. The restaurant was dirty. Trash all over the floor. 3. It took 15 min to get a drink and when I received it finally it was very watered down and had almost no alcohol in it. 4. The waitress looked pissed off all the time.  5. The burger I had was missing a piece of cheese  Worst Red Robin experience ever. Needless to say I will not be going back. TERRIBLE AND SLACK  after years of being a faithful customer.
This is our first time here in Medford.  We used to be in Highlands Ranch Colorado. It is our goto place. We had the Chili Chili Burger. It is excellent. We recommend it. Great staff.
Once again an excellent meal! Shout out to Jeremy and the kitchen staff, you guys rock! Merry Christmas!

Horrible customer service at 11a.m.! My husband and I sat in the bar for a quick bite. The waiter who looked like he was 16 years old, quickly asked for our ID's before he even greeted us. My husband forgot his wallet (we are both in our 30's) so the waiter quickly said "YOU CANT SIT HERE", like we were criminals?! That Message was clear so we moved down to the restaurant were we waited 5 minutes to be greeted from the new waitress. When she finally did we got an attitude from the her! She was busy with her ONE table and their three waters they ordered . We obviously decided to leave and grab a quick taco before our movie instead. I never write these reviews but this one needed to be written!
Amazing endless fries! The blue ribbon burger is great! I love that you get endless fries for an appetizer for no extra charge!

Food is always good. Garlic cheese fries are really good. The wait staff can be rude.  My last waitress was very nice and I complimented her. She was supposed to give me back $9.95 in change. She nicely gave me a nickel to make it an even $10.  She blew it when she gave me back a $10 bill in an obvious attempt to receive it back for an inflated tip. She was a good waitress so lucky for her a found a $5 bill.  If I had not found it she would have received nothing.

This is probably the worst Red Robin I've been to! It seemed very under staffed. The waitress we had told us we were her only table but we never got our fries or drinks refilled. My order was messed up so I did receive a discount. It was just a disappointing dinner and we won't go back to that particular Red Robin.

Went to RR last night for my annual Birthday Burger. We ate in the bar (a good place, not as noisy or crazy as the dining room) and was seated immediately. Our server was top notch. Right on the ball with getting drinks, orders, refills, etc. Had the BBQ Burger with O Rings and it was good, but for the patties being a tad overcooked. Our server was totally attentive though she had to know it would be a small check because of the B-Day free burger, and treated us like a party of 12. Good job RR.

The seating hostesses were on tablets and really had no clue what was going on with the people waiting for a table. I was in a leg boot due to a broken leg and they wanted to seat us in the bar area on high stools. Then when I told them that was not possible, we had to wait 20 minutes for another table. The servers were running around, not seeming to know what they were supposed to be doing. They spent more time on their tablets. I sure hope they get better trained staff.

Usually great but tonight I was totally disappointed. Arrived at about 4:40 PM and it was quiet. I ordered 1 cocktail & water but it took 10 minutes to receive them. Onion soup appetizer was also slow to arrive and only luke warm. Asked for more broth and was told that we'd be charged for another soup! We clearly requested extra crispy steak fries because they're usually limp and under cooked. The request was apparently ignored. We asked to re-do them and got two more orders of the same thing! Another food server that overheard our request brought another basket of crispy fries seconds later and asked if these were better.....and they were far better. We left an hour and ten minutes later. I asked for a comment card and was given a post it note...I'm calling the manager later to make sure he or she received my comments. They DID adjust our tab but tonight was NOT a stellar night for Red Robin.

Upon walking in I was warmly greater and told it would be about 10 minutes until we were seated. It was 9 minutes. We ordered the onion ring mountain and dipping sauce which was very good. We waited about 40 minutes for our food. The cod and shrimp was good but the fries were not hot. My daughter got the child's pepperoni pizza which she did not like. It was on a French roll and a little doughy. My peppercorn burger was quite underwhelming. I asked for no pink and had pink. The bread did not feel fresh and the burger was overwhelmed with soggy onion strings. The bacon was not crispy and small. The baked salmon was dry and tough to finish. We did have drink refills but no bottomless fries were offered which was a good thing because they were cold. Not a great experience.

My boyfriend and I came here last weekend because we had a craving for fries. Upon walking in we were told it would be a bit of a wait for a table, which was odd since it didn't seem too busy. After a few minutes, we were seated in what he and I agree was the worst table in the place. It was literally right next to the kitchen and a table full of fussy kids. Something was off on the table or seats because we were very far from the table and had to lean in close just to hear each other over the noise of the place. And like we had thought, it wasn't busy at all.  The food was alright. My boyfriend asked the waiter about a particular burger and was told it was just a bigger version of the one I wanted. When we got them, mine was significantly bigger for $2 less. We were both confused. Fries were good, but fries are always good.  We probably won't come back unless we just order fries, honestly.

Was not a fan of this place. My husband and I  eat at Red Robins all the time, we stopped at this location while on vacation because it was close to our hotel. If we are ever in the area again we are not coming back here.  The restaurant itself is dated the booth we sat at had tears in the seats and the backs were frayed and dirty looking (the cloth looked OLD like it hadn't been cleaned in years). The decor and carpert looked old/dirty.  The service was below average our server abandoned us, my husband's order was wrong, and we asked for more bottomless fries we were brought old/bad fries and we had to keep reminding him we were waiting for more fries.  The food was standard RR food.

Pretty horrible experience at this establishment. Typically don't go to too many chain restaurants, but we are here in town for a quick rendezvous and it we couldn't find our favorite Thai restaurant. Service was ok....food was cold...drinks were weak! We'll stick to the mom n Pop spots on our next visit.

We went at 6pm last Friday,  3 in our party and sat in a Booth in the bar.  We had to wait 10 minutes for menus, about 15 minutes for Waters, another 20 minutes to get our order taken.  Our food was delivered another 30 minutes later by somebody other than our server, and I asked him for more fries. He said he'd be right back and never materialized. Once our server realized we were impatient she came and checked on us again and finally brought us those extra fries about 20 minutes after our first food arrived. It seems like she was the only one working all the tables in the bar section. The restaurant wasn't even full.  I could see several empty tables in the main restaurant from where I was sitting.

Perhaps I don't get here as much as others, but I have NEVER had a bad meal or less than stellar service here. Yes, it's a chain. Yes, it can be crowded, but if I want a family-friendly experience at a good price, then Red Robin, Medford is it.
Terrible food.. got the burger wrong and it was cold.. remade it and it was still cold.. both meals at our table were not served at proper temp.. won't be back

I think most people post a review because of a memorable experience and I am no exception. I am an ex server so I pay a lot of attention to the service. I am well aware that it is both an art and a learned skill to manage to be there when needed without hovering or interrupting, especially when things get really busy. The young woman, Jamie, who was our server did a truly exceptional job! The food was typical Red Robin, good but not great, for example a burger and a shake from Smashburger are both better for around half the price. However, given the excellent service and hosting, the experience was well worth it!

I went to dinner with my sister and a big group tonight. Our waitress Jessica liked to disappear a lot, she didn't seem to want to give us or other tables the time of day. The food was good once it finally came but I was not very happy with the service.

My family and I were there to celebrate my daughter's 1st birthday and the staff and waitress were extremely friendly, patient, and accommodating. We had 4 adults and 5 kids (1yo-11yo) in our party. Of course our kids were extra hyper because of we were celebrating, but the waitress had a genuine smile on the entire time! Loved the service, LOVED the food, but I especially loved that they helped make my baby's day special.

Went there for my birthday and got my burger for free! It was very good and my son loved his food two meatballs on a stick and a side of fruit the service was good and they even offered to sing me a happy birthday song I will be returning!!

The food was ok, but the sauce was the highlight of my meal!!! The only trouble I found was finding a way to pour the sauce in aSs houl. ( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)( °  °)

I'm rewriting this review.  I've always liked Red Robin's burgers and would happily eat there, but last Sunday evening took the cake on this place for horrible customer service.  My last review mentioned spotty, slow service that I hoped they could overcome,  but this was over the top bad.   So my friend and I ordered two burgers.  His a lettuce wrap as he's gluten intolerant.  He told the waiter, no mayo or cheese as he's allergic to dairy and eggs.  The waiter assured him that neither came on that burger.  Okay, great! We wait for close to 45 minutes to get our food.  Two burgers, nothing fancy and right in their wheelhouse.  We thought.  FINALLY the food arrives.  His burger is covered in melted cheese!  He was so angry he refused a remake.  I ate my burger quickly and we left.  The waiter did deduct the cheese covered burger from the bill as we requested since it was uneatable.

Ordered and was told it would be 35 minutes. Ended up 55 minutes.  Got home and they didn't put part of the order in. They did call and tell me they forgot part of the order. The part of the order that we got wad good.

So sub par for a Red Robin. Service is extremely slow. Still waiting for the bill. Food took a really long time to get out. It was good when it arrived. Plenty of staff so no idea what happened. People after us were served before us.

3/4 burgers we had tonight were good, but when I brought home a salmon burger to my wife when she got off work, we opened it to find a very badly freezer burned piece of farmed fish. I know, farmed fish is to be expected at a chain restaurant, but this barely passed for fish. She couldn't even eat the burger it was so bad, ate the fries and trashed the sandwich.
Love this place!  Trick is to sit at the bar so the service is top notch!  Love the food and the atmosphere and BOTTOMLESS fries baby!

This establishment has become a subpar chucky cheese millennial hiring factory. The waiters/ waitresses are completely fixated on getting done with they're shift, rather than servicing customers properly. I haven't been here in 2 years because of the poor service and seems as though nothing has changed. I will not recommend this establishment to anyone I know in the future.
